attributes.action: Invoke an act of Parliament to determine the UK's membership of the EU.
attributes.additional_details: The government of the United Kingdom of Great Britain and Northern Ireland has a duty of care to act in the short, medium and long-term interests of its people. Furthermore, the impact of leaving the EU will be felt more acutely by the younger members of society, and we have a responsibility to act in the best interests of future generations, not only to serve our immediate aspirations. With ~700,000 new young voters each year, by the time we leave the EU - it will not be the popular choice.
attributes.background: Leaving the EU will have a profound impact on both the UK and the EU, and the economic implications will be felt globally. Such a significant decision should only be taken by those who are sufficiently informed of the potential pros or cons.
